alert.note: Alert for Hockley; Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 30 at 1:46PM CST by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Lubbock and east central Hockley Counties through 215 PM CST... At 146 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wolfforth, or 9 miles west of Lubbock, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects and vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Lubbock, Wolfforth, Lubbock International Airport, Texas Tech University, Downtown Lubbock, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Woodrow, Reese Center, and Lubbock Science Spectrum. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Light accumulations of small hail will be possible.
